question: [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: push()] [Chunk ordering guarantee] Can an attacker manipulating backup storage cause futures to be pushed in arbitrary order at line 118, breaking the assumption that push order matches chunk sequential ordering, leading to state corruption during restore? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Duplicate chunk processing] If the same backup chunk is accidentally pushed twice with different indices, can both be processed by poll_next() without detection, causing duplicate data insertion during restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: extend()] [Batch corruption] When extend() at line 169 is used to add multiple backup chunks, can iterator panic or early return cause only partial batch to be added with non-contiguous indices, breaking chunk sequence integrity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Index comparison] Can integer underflow in index comparison at lines 130 and 139 occur if next_outgoing_index wraps around while OrderWrapper indices are large, causing incorrect equality checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: push()] [Index assignment race] Between reading self.next_incoming_index at line 115 and assigning it to wrapped.index, can another thread modify next_incoming_index, causing duplicate index assignment? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Increment atomicity] Are the increments at lines 131 and 140 (this.next_outgoing_index += 1) atomic operations, or can they be interrupted causing partial increments and index corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: new()] [Index initialization race] Can the initialization of next_incoming_index and next_outgoing_index at lines 86-87 race with immediate push() calls in multi-threaded scenarios, causing indices to start from wrong values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [CPU exhaustion] Can an attacker cause the loop at line 136 to spin indefinitely by ensuring in_progress_queue always returns futures with indices > next_outgoing_index, consuming 100% CPU and preventing backup completion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: push()] [Queue flooding] Can pushing millions of futures via push() at line 112 without rate limiting cause next_incoming_index to increment uncontrollably, eventually causing overflow and backup system failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Starvation attack] By carefully timing future completion, can an attacker cause poll_next() to always find mismatched indices at lines 130/139, accumulating results in queued_outputs until memory is exhausted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: is_empty()] [Resource leak check] Does is_empty() at line 102 being false prevent stream cleanup if no progress is being made, causing backup resources to leak indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Empty stream behavior] When both in_progress_queue and queued_outputs are empty, does poll_next() properly return Poll::Ready(None) immediately, or can it return Poll::Pending causing backup operations to hang? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Single future case] When exactly one future is pushed and completed, do the checks at lines 129-134 and 136-148 both attempt to process it, potentially causing double-processing or index corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: new()] [Zero-capacity] What happens if FuturesOrderedX::new(max_in_progress) is called where max_in_progress causes FuturesUnorderedX to reject all futures, creating a permanently stalled backup stream? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Max index] When next_outgoing_index reaches usize::MAX-1, does incrementing it at lines 131/140 cause overflow to 0, breaking all subsequent index comparisons and corrupting backup ordering? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: len()] [Overflow in len] Can the addition in len() at line 97 overflow when both queues contain usize::MAX/2 items, causing len() to return 0 or small value and breaking size_hint() calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Spurious wakeups] Can spurious wakeups cause poll_next() to be called repeatedly even when no futures have completed, wasting CPU cycles during long backup operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: OrderWrapper::poll()] [Pin safety] Does the pin projection at line 60 (self.project().data.poll(cx)) maintain pinning guarantees if the underlying future type requires structural pinning? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Context propagation] Is the Context passed to poll_next() at line 125 correctly propagated through all nested poll calls, or can waker registration be lost causing futures to never wake? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Poll after completion] If poll_next() is called after returning Poll::Ready(None), does it properly maintain the terminated state or can it incorrectly process newly pushed futures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: OrderWrapper] [Generic variance] Can the OrderWrapper<T> type at line 25 be used with unsound generic parameters that violate the Future trait bounds, causing undefined behavior during backup operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: FuturesOrderedX] [Unpin assumption] Since FuturesOrderedX is declared Unpin at line 75, can this cause safety issues if the wrapped futures require pinning guarantees that are violated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Poll trait bounds] Does poll_next_unpin() at line 137 properly enforce that the underlying stream is Unpin, or can it cause memory safety issues with pinned types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Use after free] After PeekMut::pop(next_output) at line 132, can the popped value's memory be accessed if other references exist, causing use-after-free in backup data processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/futures_ordered_x.rs] [Function: extend()] [Iterator lifetime] Can the iterator passed to extend() at line 173 contain references that outlive their backing storage, causing dangling references when futures are polled? (Medium)
